name: flaggedpages
comment: Derived table for tracking flagged revisions. Contains a row for every page which has a stable version (ie. has at least one revision which has been reviewed).

columns.name: fp_page_id
columns.comment: Foreign key to page.page_id

columns.name: fp_reviewed
columns.comment: Is the stable version synced? On wikis where $wgFlaggedRevsHandleIncludes is set to FR_INCLUDES_STABLE, this will be true when all templates used on the page are either fully reviewed or haven't changed since this page was last reviewed. (See flaggedtemplates table.) On other wikis, always true.

columns.name: fp_pending_since
columns.comment: When (or NULL) the first edit after the stable version was made, ie. how long this page has been waiting for review

columns.name: fp_stable
columns.comment: The revision ID of the stable revision. Foreign key to flaggedrevs.fr_rev_id

columns.name: fp_quality
columns.comment: The highest quality of the page's reviewed revisions. Not useful anymore as levels other than checked (0) have been removed. (Historical values are 1=quality, 2=pristine.)

name: flaggedpage_pending
comment: Derived table for tracking edits needing review. Contains a row for each page which has a stable version and pending edits. Basically the same as flaggedpages, without the rows where fp_pending_since is NULL. Was more useful in the past when there were multiple quality levels.

columns.name: fpp_page_id
columns.comment: Foreign key to page.page_id

columns.name: fpp_quality
columns.comment: The quality tier. Not useful anymore as levels other than checked (0) have been removed. (Historical values are 1=quality, 2=pristine.)

columns.name: fpp_rev_id
columns.comment: The last rev ID with this quality (ie. the revision ID of the stable revision).

columns.name: fpp_pending_since
columns.comment: Time of the first edit after the last revision reviewed to this level

name: flaggedrevs
comment: Data about reviews of revisions. This is the primary data, most other tables are derived from this. The template version data is stored in flaggedtemplates.

columns.name: fr_rev_id
columns.comment: Foreign key to revision.rev_id

columns.name: fr_rev_timestamp
columns.comment: Timestamp of when the edit happened (copy of revision.rev_timestamp)

columns.name: fr_page_id
columns.comment: Foreign key to page.page_id

columns.name: fr_user
columns.comment: Reviewer ID. Foreign key to user.user_id.

columns.name: fr_timestamp
columns.comment: Timestamp of when the review happened.

columns.name: fr_quality
columns.comment: Quality level of the review. Not useful anymore as levels other than checked (0) have been removed. (Historical values are 1=quality, 2=pristine.)

columns.name: fr_tags
columns.comment: Store tag metadata as newline separated, colon separated tag:value pairs. Tags used to represent different dimensions of the review, e.g. 'accuracy:1, coverage:1, style:2', with certain levels for certain tags required for each quality level. Since then, multiple quality levels and multiple dimensions have been discarded, so this field doesn't really have a point anymore.

columns.name: fr_flags
columns.comment: Comma-separated list of flags: - dynamic: conversion marker for inclusion handling (legacy schema had fr_text with PST text). - auto: revision reviewed automatically

name: flaggedtemplates
comment: Per-article template reviews. Only used in FR_INCLUDES_STABLE mode. Stores which were the current revisions of each template used in the revision ft_rev_id when it last got reviewed. To hide template vandalism, when the stable version of the article is shown, each template will be shown using the newer of 1) the stable version of the template or 2) the template version which was shown when the article was last reviewed. Unreviewed template changes will make the article show up in the review queue even if the article itself has been fully reviewed. By default, there are template flaggedtemplates rows corresponding to every flaggedrevs row; pruneRevData.php can be used to remove template data for old revisions.

columns.name: ft_rev_id
columns.comment: Article revision ID. Foreign key to flaggedrevs.fr_rev_id.

columns.name: ft_tmp_rev_id
columns.comment: Template revision ID (the last revision of the template at the moment the article corresponding to ft_rev_id was reviewed).

name: flaggedpage_config
comment: Stores per-page settings on how to select the stable/default revision. Can be changed by users with the 'stablesettings' right.

columns.name: fpc_page_id
columns.comment: Foreign key to page.page_id

columns.name: fpc_override
columns.comment: Override the page? (0 = always show latest revision, 1 = show stable revision for anonymous users)

columns.name: fpc_level
columns.comment: The restriction level (sysop, etc) for reviewing/autoreviewing the page.

columns.name: fpc_expiry
columns.comment: Expiry for time-limited settings; configuration reverts to default after this timestamp.

name: flaggedrevs_tracking
comment: Derived table for tracking dependencies for the stable versions. For a given page with a stable version, contains a row for every link, template and category which is present in the stable version but not in the current version (ie. not tracked in pagelinks/templatelinks/categorylinks). Used like the normal dependency tables, to re-render the stable version when a dependency changes.

columns.name: ftr_from
columns.comment: Page ID of the page with the stable version.

columns.name: ftr_namespace
columns.comment: Namespace of the dependency.

columns.name: ftr_title
columns.comment: Title (dbkey) of the dependency.

name: flaggedrevs_promote
comment: Stores user statistics for autopromotion/autodemotion (see $wgFlaggedRevsAutoconfirm and $wgFlaggedRevsAutopromote).

columns.name: frp_user_id
columns.comment: Foreign key to user.user_id

columns.name: frp_user_params
columns.comment: A newline-separated list of user parameters in the param=value format. Parameters: - uniqueContentPages: comma-separated list of IDs of content page the user has edited (truncated to the length required for autopromotion features). - totalContentEdits: total edits made in content namespaces. - editComments: total edits made with a comment (in any namespace). - revertedEdits: total number of reverted edits.

name: flaggedrevs_statistics
comment: Derived table storing various site-level statistics. See FlaggedRevsStats.php.

columns.name: frs_timestamp
columns.comment: Timestamp stat was recorded

columns.name: frs_stat_key
columns.comment: Stat key name. Might contain a colon-delimited parameter at the end, for per-namespace stats or stats calculated at multiple percentile levels.

columns.name: frs_stat_val
columns.comment: Stat value as an integer
